articles.author: Jeff Mason
articles.title: Trump tells evangelical rally he will put prayer in schools
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Friday said his Democratic opponents would tear down crosses and pledged to bring prayer to public schools at a re-election rally to shore up evangelical support.
articles.content:
MIAMI/WASHINGTON (Reuters) - U.S. President Donald Trump on Friday said his Democratic opponents would tear down crosses and pledged to bring prayer to public schools at a re-election rally to shore up evangelical support. 
Trump spoke on the outskirts of Mi… [+2440 chars]

articles.title: IN BRIEF: Prickett Jones & Elliott attorney tapped for Dela. Chancery Court
articles.description: Delaware Governor John Carney on Friday announced Paul Fioravanti Jr, a director at law firm Prickett Jones & Elliott, as his pick for vice chancellor of the state's Court of Chancery.'
articles.content:
Delaware Governor John Carney on Friday announced Paul Fioravanti Jr, a director at law firm Prickett Jones & Elliott, as his pick for vice chancellor of the state’s Court of Chancery. 
The Delaware Senate is set to consider Fioravanti’s nomination later… [+325 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Trump says he 'terminated' top Iran general to thwart attack on Americans
articles.description: Iran promised vengeance after a U.S. air strike in Baghdad on Friday killed Qassem Soleimani, Tehran's most prominent military commander and the architect of its growing influence in the Middle East. Jonah Green has more.
articles.content:
Posted 
Iran promised vengeance after a U.S. air strike in Baghdad on Friday killed Qassem Soleimani, Tehran's most prominent military commander and the architect of its growing influence in the Middle East. Jonah Green has more.

articles.author: Jennifer Hiller
articles.title: UPDATE 1-U.S. shale producer shares spike with oil prices but rise seen as fleeting
articles.description: Shares of U.S. shale producers climbed on Friday as Middle East tensions boosted oil prices to an eight-month high, but the bump is likely to prove temporary as companies stay focused on cost-cutting in 2020.
articles.content:
(Updates closing prices, adds analyst comment) 
By Jennifer Hiller and Liz Hampton

articles.author: Rich McKay
articles.title: Conservative, liberal Methodists to split over gay marriage
articles.description: The United Methodist Church plans to split into two later this year, church officials said on Friday, a schism that follows years of contention over whether the church should end its ban on same-sex marriage and gay clergy.
articles.content:
(Reuters) - The United Methodist Church plans to split into two later this year, church officials said on Friday, a schism that follows years of contention over whether the church should end its ban on same-sex marriage and gay clergy.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Flights suspended in Libya's capital as violence intensifies
articles.description: Flights were suspended at the only functioning airport in Libya's capital Tripoli on Friday because of rocket fire and shelling, as people in eastern Libya protested Turkish military support for their rivals.
articles.content:
TRIPOLI (Reuters) - Flights were suspended at the only functioning airport in Libya’s capital Tripoli on Friday because of rocket fire and shelling, as people in eastern Libya protested Turkish military support for their rivals.

articles.title: Miley Cyrus settles $300 million lawsuit claiming she stole 'We Can't Stop'

articles.author: Valentina Za
articles.title: Italy's Atlantia slips further into 'junk' status on concession risks
articles.description: Italian infrastructure group Atlantia on Friday suffered its second debt downgrade in a month, slipping further into junk territory, as the government considers revoking the group's motorway concession following a deadly bridge collapse.
articles.content:
